title: What's the best song you haven't heard in years? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just seeing this question made me think for a minute, “What haven’t I heard in years that I’d like to right now?” I was so accustomed to hearing certain songs all the time when I was much younger, but they’re not Classic Rock or 80’s music or dance music, or even huge Top 40 hits that may get played on this stationeries or that anymore since the formats of new radio and internet streaming services tend toward the biggies, the instantly familiar. So I took a look into my piles of older stuff and ended up in the 1970’s. Since the radio was on all the time then, I heard tons of tunes, but after the 70’s, many of those hits faded away. Let’s see if I can resurrect a few for this answer. Lee Michaels: “Do You Know What I Mean” (from 5th, 1971)  Redbone: “Come And Get Your Love” (from Wovoka, 1973)  Wet Willie: “Keep On Smilin’” (from Keep On Smilin’, 1974)  Starbuck: “Moonlight Feels Right” (from Moonlight Feels Right, 1976)  Walter Egan: “Magnet And Steel” (from Not Shy, 1978)  Free Movement: “I’ve Found Someone Of My Own” (from I’ve Found Someone Of My Own, 1971)  Johnny Bristol: “Hang On In There, Baby” (from Hang On In There, Baby, 1974)  Bloodstone: “Natural High” (from Natural High, 1973)  Raydio: “You Can’t Change That” (from Rock On, 1979)  The Blackbyrds: “Walking In Rhythm” (from Flying Start, 1974)  There’s a quick list. I could’ve been at this all day. Maybe you’ll find one or two you like, too.

I have started searching for old songs on youtube and Spotify occasionally when I talked with my wife about what songs we remember from our youth and if we know the same songs. Once I came up recently with is Indian Reservation by Don Fardon. Haven’t heard that in years, a really good song I think
